channel.title: Lifepoints and Login lobby
channel.description:
http://services.runescape.com/m=news/newsitem.ws?id=2709
Sounds pretty cool, it'll take a bit to get used to though.
The lobby seems to be an effort for more members, but also pretty cool.

item.title: Lifepoints and Login lobby
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:24, topic:331499”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=427879.msg3143107#msg3143107 date=1267802455]
Yo Daniel, before you couldn’t hit 0.1 (which would be 1 now), unless I’m mistaken.
[/quote]
From what i’ve seen this is exactly it. Instead of not seeing the decimal they just remove the decimal point and attach the # behind it.

Old (80.0)
New (800)[/quote]
meaning overall damage done over time is greater than before.

old probability: 1/
new 1/( * 10), though the probability of hitting your max is smaller, the probability of hitting anything is greater

Read full topic

item.title: Lifepoints and Login lobby
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Lobby update - awesome

Miniature slayer updates- awesome

‘Constitution’ - not so much. I’ve been playing for a few days and really can’t get used to it. I went to a PvP world to watch fights and the dragon claw hits basically overlap the whole character. The update was basically useless except in a few aspects.

I don’t see why they just didn’t keep the old hitpoints and spend the time working on something fun. I can’t see how hitting 750s is anymore fun than hitting a 75.

Read full topic

item.title: Lifepoints and Login lobby
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Ollie:

Yo Daniel, before you couldn’t hit 0.1 (which would be 1 now), unless I’m mistaken.

Hadn’t thought of that, but you can hit higher than your old max now which makes up for it a bit.

Read full topic

I really think all the weapons have been nerfed cuz I keep hitting 100s with rune scimmy.
[/quote]

om… That means you where hitting 10s before. Seems accurate enough[/quote]I know but my account’s attack level is 89 and strength 92 so it makes no sense that I’m constantly hitting 10s when I used to hit 20s all the time before this update.

item.title: Lifepoints and Login lobby
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:15, topic:331499”]on the contrary, if you were going to hit 0 before, you might hit 1 or 2 now, etc. maybe even 9, assuming they rounded down before

edit: divided by 10[/quote]

Nah you either hit, or hit 0. If you do hit it rolls again to determine what you hit.

It still doesn’t make you weaker though. Say your max is 20, and ‘hitting high’ is 15+ and hitting low is 6 or less.

The chance of hitting high or low was 6/20, now it’s 60/200. Same shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Lifepoints and Login lobby
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:12, topic:331499”]The downside:

…

For example, let’s say in RuneScape, before the update you had 30 hp. A monster with a max hit of 12 hits an 8, a 12, and a 10, killing you. Now since its max hit is 120, it’s much more likely to hit something way below that, such as 50, 80, 100, etc… Which means you’re less likely to die.

The same applies for a player with a max hit of 40 before the update. Now they have a max hit of 400 but might hit much, much lower, maybe a 10 for example

That could explain why people feel weaker after the update:

[quote author=Frell link=topic=427879.msg3142201#msg3142201 date=1267675756]
I feel alot weaker after this update, possibly Jagex used it to cover a overall weapon damage overhaul.
[/quote][/quote]
on the contrary, if you were going to hit 0 before, you might hit 1 or 2 now, etc. maybe even 9, assuming they rounded down before

edit: divided by 10

Read full topic

For example, let’s say in RuneScape, before the update you had 30 hp. A monster with a max hit of 12 hits an 8, a 12, and a 10, killing you. Now since its max hit is 120, it’s much more likely to hit something way below that, such as 50, 80, 100, etc… Which means you’re less likely to die.[/quote]

The same applies for a player with a max hit of 40 before the update. Now they have a max hit of 400 but might hit much, much lower, maybe a 10 for example

That could explain why people feel weaker after the update:

Frell:

I feel alot weaker after this update, possibly Jagex used it to cover a overall weapon damage overhaul.

chri5:

It was fine before. WHY TIMES EVERYTHING BY 10

Read the fucking page long blog they wrote about why they did it.

cane:

I like the new updates it has made world hopping and going afk a lot easier and the new lifepoints are great they make fighting look more fun. Also the new life points will give more chances for jagex to add more things like health potions etc…

Agreed, i cant wait until all the complaining stops.
